item.title: How-To Create A Symbolic Link In Windows 10
item.description: To create a symbolic link: Run Command Prompt as an Administrator (This won't work with PowerShell) To link a file: mklink PATH_TO_MAKE SOURCE_PATH And for a directory: mklink /D PATH_TO_MAKE SOURCE_PATH Notes See if there’s a way to do this with PowerShell Add hard links # file: mklink /H PATH_TO_MAKE SOURCE_PATH # directory: mklink /J PATH_TO_MAKE SOURCE_PATH
